sen.j: 藤原 仲麻呂（ふじわら の なかまろ、慶雲3年（706年） - 天平宝字8年9月18日 (旧暦)（764年10月21日））は、奈良時代の公卿。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (706 - October 21, 764) was a kugyo (a high court noble) of the Nara Period.
FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (706 - October 21, 764) was a kugyo (a high court noble) of the Nara Period.
FUJIWARA no Nakamaro (706 - October 21, 764) was a kugyo (a high court noble) of the Nara Period.

sen.j: 父は藤原武智麻呂。
sen.e: His father was FUJIWARA no Muchimaro.
His father was FUJIWARA no Muchimaro.
His father was FUJIWARA no Muchimaro.

sen.j: 恵美押勝（えみのおしかつ、藤原恵美朝臣押勝）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: He was also called EMI no Oshikatsu (FUJIWARA Emi no Ason Oshikatsu).
sen.cmt: 藤原恵美朝臣押勝：読み方不明です。
sen.e: He was also called EMI no Oshikatsu (FUJIWARA Emi no Ason Oshikatsu).
He was also called EMI no Oshikatsu (FUJIWARA Emi no Ason Oshikatsu).

sen.j: 『公卿補任』、『尊卑分脈』には"仲麿"または"仲丸"と記載されている。
sen.e: In the "Kugyobunin" (a directory of court nobles) and the "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (records of the lineages of the aristocracy), Nakamaro (仲麻呂) is also referred to as "仲麿" (Nakamaro) or "仲丸" (Nakamaro).
In the "Kugyobunin" (a directory of court nobles) and the "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (records of the lineages of the aristocracy), Nakamaro (仲麻呂) is also referred to as "仲麿" (Nakamaro) or "仲丸" (Nakamaro).
In the "Kugyobunin" (a directory of court nobles) and the "Sonpi Bunmyaku" (records of the lineages of the aristocracy), Nakamaro (仲麻呂) is also referred to as "仲麿" (Nakamaro) or "仲丸" (Nakamaro).

sen.j: 聖武天皇の時代
sen.e: The Era of Emperor Shomu
The Era of Emperor Shomu
The Era of the Emperor Shomu
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 「続日本紀」は仲麻呂を「率性聡敏にして、略書記にわたる」と評している。
sen.e: In "Shoku Nihongi' (Chronicle of Japan Continued), Nakamaro is viewed as 'clever and 略書記にわたる'
sen.cmt: 「略書記にわたる」：意味不明のため訳出不可でした。
sen.e: In "Shoku Nihongi' (Chronicle of Japan Continued), Nakamaro is viewed as 'clever and 略書記にわたる'
In 'Shoku Nihongi' (Chronicle of Japan Continued), Nakamaro is viewed as 'clever and 略書記にわたる'
sen.cmt: "を'に変更しました。訳出不明なままです。

sen.j: 年少にして大納言・安倍宿奈麻呂に算術を学び、すぐれた学才を示した。
sen.e: At a young age, Nakamaro learned arithmetic from ABE no Sukunamaro, Dainagon (the chief councilor of the state), and showed his excellent academic ability.
At a young age, Nakamaro learned arithmetic from ABE no Sukunamaro, Dainagon (the chief councilor of the state), and showed excellent academic ability.
At a young age, Nakamaro learned arithmetic from ABE no Sukunamaro, Dainagon (the chief councilor of the state), and showed excellent academic ability.

sen.j: 大学少允に最初に任官し、天平6年（734年）、従五位下に進む。
sen.e: He was first appointed as Daigaku no shojo (a junior secretary) and promoted to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 734.
He was first appointed as Daigaku no shojo (a junior secretary) and promoted to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 734.
He was first appointed as Daigaku no shojo (a junior secretary) and promoted to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 734.

sen.j: 天平9年（737年）、天然痘の流行により父の武智麻呂を含む藤原四兄弟が相次いで死去し、藤原氏の勢力は大きく後退した。
sen.e: In 737, a smallpox epidemic killed his father, Muchimaro, and his four brothers one after another, which greatly reduced the power of the FUJIWARA clan.
In 737, a smallpox epidemic killed his father, Muchimaro, and his four brothers one after another, which greatly reduced the power of the FUJIWARA clan.
In 737, a smallpox epidemic killed his father, Muchimaro, and his four brothers one after another, which greatly reduced the power of the FUJIWARA clan.

sen.j: 代わって橘諸兄が台頭して国政を担うようになった。
sen.e: On the contrary, TACHIBANA no Moroe rose and took in charge of affairs of the state.
On the contrary, TACHIBANA no Moroe rose and took charge of affairs of the state.
On the contrary, TACHIBANA no Moroe rose and took charge of affairs of the state.

sen.j: 天平13年（741年）、民部省。
sen.e: In 741, Nakamaro joined the Minbu-sho (Ministry of Popular Affairs).
In 741, Nakamaro joined the Minbu-sho (Ministry of Popular Affairs).
In 741, Nakamaro joined the Minbu-sho (Ministry of Popular Affairs).

sen.j: 天平15年（743年）、参議となる。
sen.e: In 743, he was promoted to Sangi (a councilor).
In 743, he was promoted to Sangi (a councilor).
In 743, he was promoted to Sangi (a councilor).

sen.j: 天平18年（746年）、式部省に転じる。
sen.e: In 746, he was transferred to the Shikibu-sho (Ministry of Ceremonial).
In 746, he was transferred to the Shikibu-sho (Ministry of Ceremonial).
In 746, he was transferred to the Shikibu-sho (Ministry of Ceremonial).

sen.j: 仲麻呂は叔母にあたる光明皇后の信任が厚く、また皇太子孝謙天皇ともこの時は良好な関係にあったとされる。
sen.e: It is believed that Nakamaro enjoyed a deep trust of Empress Komyo, his aunt, and had a good relationship with her Crown Princess, Empress Koken, at that time.
sen.cmt: 「皇太子孝謙天皇」：女性の天皇なので、皇太子を Crown Princess にしていますが、適切なものに変更ください。加えて、皇太子と天皇を並べて使用してよいのかわかりません。
sen.e: It is believed that Nakamaro enjoyed the deep trust of Empress Komyo, his aunt, and had a good relationship with her Crown Princess, Empress Koken, at that time.
It is believed that Nakamaro enjoyed the deep trust of the Empress Komyo, his aunt, and had a good relationship with her Crown Princess, the Empress Koken, at that time.
sen.cmt: Empressの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 天平16年1月13日 (旧暦)（744年3月1日）の安積親王の恭仁京での急死は､仲麻呂による毒殺説があるが疑問も出されている。
sen.e: There is a speculation that Nakamaro poisoned Prince Asaka in the ancient capital of Kuni-kyo (present-day Kyoto Prefecture) and led him to a sudden death in March 1, 744, but some doubted the theory.

There is a speculation that Nakamaro poisoned Prince Asaka in the ancient capital of Kuni-kyo (present-day Kyoto Prefecture) and led him to a sudden death in March 1, 744, but some doubted the theory.

There is a speculation that Nakamaro poisoned Prince Asaka in the ancient capital of Kuni-kyo (present-day Kyoto Prefecture) and led him to a sudden death in February 5, 744, but some doubted the theory.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: 孝謙天皇の時代
sen.e: The Era of Empress Koken
The Era of Empress Koken
The Era of the Empress Koken
sen.cmt: Empressの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 天平勝宝元年（749年）、聖武天皇が譲位して阿倍内親王が即位（孝謙天皇）すると、仲麻呂は大納言に昇進。
sen.e: In 749 when Emperor Shomu abdicated the throne to Imperial Princess Abe and she ascended to the Imperial Throne (Empress Koken), Nakamaro was promoted to Dainagon (the chief councilor of the state).
In 749 when Emperor Shomu abdicated the throne to Imperial Princess Abe and she ascended to the Imperial Throne (Empress Koken), Nakamaro was promoted to Dainagon (the chief councilor of the state).

In 749 when the Emperor Shomu abdicated the throne to Imperial Princess Abe and she ascended to the Imperial Throne (the Empress Koken), Nakamaro was promoted to Dainagon (the chief councilor of the state).
sen.cmt: Emperor, Empressの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 次いで、光明皇后のために設けられた紫微中台の令（長官）を兼ねた。
sen.e: Later, he doubled as a director of the Shibi chudai (the office handling the Empress Komyo's affairs) which was built for Empress Komyo.
Later, he doubled as a director of the Shibi chudai (the office handling the Empress Komyo's affairs) which was built for Empress Komyo.
Later, he doubled as a director of the Shibi chudai (the office handling the Empress Komyo's affairs) which was built for the Empress Komyo.
sen.cmt: 二番目のEmpressの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 仲麻呂は更に中務省と五衛府も兼ねた。
sen.e: He was also appointed as an official to the Nakatsukasa-sho (Ministry of Central Affairs) and Goefu, Five Royal Guard at the same time.
He was also appointed as an official to the Nakatsukasa-sho (Ministry of Central Affairs) and Goefu, Five Royal Guards, at the same time.
He was also appointed as an official to the Nakatsukasa-sho (Ministry of Central Affairs) and Goefu, Five Royal Guards, at the same time.

sen.j: 光明皇后と孝謙天皇の信任を背景に政権と軍権の両方を掌握した仲麻呂は、左大臣橘諸兄と権勢を競うようになった。
sen.e: With a trust of Empress Komyo and Empress Koken, Nakamaro seized power both in the government and military, and started to compete against TACHIBANA no Moroe, Sadaijin (Minister of the left), to gain ultimate power in the Imperial Court.

With the trust of Empress Komyo and Empress Koken, Nakamaro seized power both in the government and military, and started to compete against TACHIBANA no Moroe, Sadaijin (Minister of the left), to gain ultimate power in the Imperial Court.

With the trust of the Empress Komyo and the Empress Koken, Nakamaro seized power both in the government and military, and started to compete against TACHIBANA no Moroe, Sadaijin (Minister of the left), to gain ultimate power in the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: Empressの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 天平勝宝7歳（755年）、諸兄が朝廷を誹謗したとの密告があり、諸兄は恥じて官を辞職し、2年後に失意のうちに死去した。
sen.e: In 755, however, Moroe resigned his post from humiliation when it was revealed that he defamed the Imperial Court, and died in despair two years later.
In 755, however, Moroe resigned his post in shame when it was revealed that he defamed the Imperial Court, and died in despair two years later.
In 755, however, Moroe resigned his post in shame when it was revealed that he defamed the Imperial Court, and died in despair two years later.

sen.j: 天平勝宝8歳（756年）、聖武太上天皇が崩御し、遺言により道祖王が皇太子された。
sen.e: In 756, Shomu Daijo Tenno (the retired Emperor Shomu) died and Funado no Okimi became the Crown Prince according to the will of Shomu Daijo Tenno.
In 756, Shomu Daijo Tenno (the retired Emperor Shomu) died and Funado no Okimi became the Crown Prince according to the will of Shomu Daijo Tenno.
In 756, Shomu Daijo Tenno (the retired Emperor Shomu) died and Funado no Okimi became the Crown Prince according to the will of Shomu Daijo Tenno.

sen.j: だが天平宝字元年（757年）3月、道祖王は喪中の不徳な行動が問題視されて廃太子された。
sen.e: However, in March 757, Prince Funado was deposed from the Crown Prince for his unethical demeanor during the mourning period of the deceased Shomu Daijo Tenno.
However, in March 757, Prince Funado was deposed from the Crown Prince for his unethical demeanor during the mourning period of the deceased Shomu Daijo Tenno.
However, in March 757, Prince Funado was deposed from the Crown Prince for his unethical demeanor during the mourning period of the deceased Shomu Daijo Tenno.

sen.j: 代わって、仲麻呂の早世した長男藤原真従の未亡人（粟田諸姉）を妃とする淳仁天皇が立太子される。
sen.e: As a replacement, Emperor Junnin, who was married to the widow (AWATA no Morone) of Nakamaro's first son, FUJIWARA no Maryori, was formally installed as the Crown Prince.
As a replacement, Emperor Junnin, who was married to the widow (AWATA no Morone) of Nakamaro's first son, FUJIWARA no Maryori, was formally installed as the Crown Prince.
As a replacement, the Emperor Junnin, who was married to the widow (AWATA no Morone) of Nakamaro's first son, FUJIWARA no Mayori, was formally installed as the Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。MaryoriをMayoriに変更しました。

sen.j: 5月、祖父の藤原不比等が着手した養老律令を施行。
sen.e: In May, the Yoro Ritsuryo Code (a code promulgated in the Yoro period) which was first undertaken by his grandfather, FUJIWARA no Fuhito, was enforced.
In May, the Yoro Ritsuryo Code (a code promulgated in the Yoro period) which was first undertaken by his grandfather, FUJIWARA no Fuhito, was enforced.
In May, the Yoro Ritsuryo Code (a code promulgated in the Yoro period) which was first undertaken by his grandfather, FUJIWARA no Fuhito, was enforced.

sen.j: 同月、仲麻呂は紫微内相（大臣に准じる）に進む。
sen.e: In the same month, Nakamaro was promoted to Shibinaiso (with the same treatment as Daijin [Minister]).
In the same month, Nakamaro was promoted to Shibinaiso (with the same treatment as Daijin [Minister]).
In the same month, Nakamaro was promoted to Shibinaiso (with the same treatment as Daijin [Minister]).

sen.j: 仲麻呂の台頭に不満を持ったのが橘諸兄の子の橘奈良麻呂であった。
sen.e: However, TACHIBANA no Naramaro, the son of TACHIBANA no Moroe, was not happy with the rise of Nakamaro.
However, TACHIBANA no Naramaro, the son of TACHIBANA no Moroe, was not happy with the rise of Nakamaro.
However, TACHIBANA no Naramaro, the son of TACHIBANA no Moroe, was not happy with the rise of Nakamaro.

sen.j: 奈良麻呂は、大伴古麻呂らとともに仲麻呂を殺害し、黄文王らを擁立するなどの反乱を企てるが、同年6月、上道斐太都らの密告により露見。
sen.e: Maramaro conspired with OOTOMO no Komaro to kill Nakamaro and back up Prince Kibumi, but it was revealed by Kamitsumichi no Hitatsu in June the same year.
Naramaro conspired with OOTOMO no Komaro to kill Nakamaro and back up Prince Kibumi, but it was revealed by Kamitsumichi no Hitatsu in June the same year.
Naramaro conspired with OTOMO no Komaro to kill Nakamaro and back up Prince Kibumi, but it was revealed by Kamitsumichi no Hitatsu in June of the same year.
sen.cmt: OOTOMOをOTOMOに変更しました。Juneの後にofを挿入しました。

sen.j: 奈良麻呂の一味は捕らえられ、443人が処罰される大事件となった。
sen.e: This assassination plot grew to be a major incident in which the Naramaro faction was arrested and 443 people were punished.
This assassination plot grew to be a major incident in which the Naramaro faction was arrested and 443 people were punished.
This assassination plot grew to be a major incident in which the Naramaro faction was arrested and 443 people were punished.

sen.j: 奈良麻呂、道祖王、大伴古麻呂らは拷問で獄死、事件に関与したとして仲麻呂の兄の右大臣藤原豊成も左遷された。
sen.e: Naramaro, Prince Funado and OOTOMO no Komaro were killed by torture, and the older brother of Nakamaro, FUJIWARA no Toyonari (Udaijin [Minister of the right]), was also relegated to a lower position for his involvement in the plot.

Naramaro, Prince Funado and OOTOMO no Komaro were killed by torture, and the older brother of Nakamaro, FUJIWARA no Toyonari (Udaijin [Minister of the right]), was also relegated to a lower position for his involvement in the plot.

Naramaro, Prince Funado and OTOMO no Komaro were killed by torture, and the older brother of Nakamaro, FUJIWARA no Toyonari (Udaijin [Minister of the right]), was also relegated to a lower position for his involvement in the plot.

sen.j: 淳仁天皇の時代
sen.e: The Era of Emperor Junnin
The Era of Emperor Junnin
The Era of the Emperor Junnin
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 天平宝字2年（758年）、孝謙天皇が譲位して大炊王が即位（淳仁天皇）した。
sen.e: In 758, Emperor Koken abdicated the throne to Prince Oi and the Prince ascended to the Imperial Throne as Emperor Junnin.
In 758, Emperor Koken abdicated the throne to Prince Oi and the Prince ascended to the Imperial Throne as Emperor Junnin.
In 758, the Emperor Koken abdicated the throne to Prince Oi and the Prince ascended to the Imperial Throne as the Emperor Junnin.
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 淳仁天皇を擁立した仲麻呂は独自な政治を行うようになり、中男・正丁の年齢繰上げや雑徭の半減、問民苦使・平準署の創設など徳治政策を進めるとともに、官名を唐風に改称させるなど唐風政策を推進した（太政官→乾政官、太政大臣→大師など。
sen.e: Nakamaro who backed up Emperor Junnin started unique politics by promoting Tokuji policies (ruling a nation by virtue of a sovereign), which included raising the age of chunan (men between 17 to 20 years of age) and seitei (men between 21 and 60 years of age) and halving the amount of zoyo (irregular corvee), and also by adopting more Chinese-style systems such as renaming of the government posts in a Chinese style, (i.e. Daijokan [Grand Council of State] was changed into Kenseikan, and Daijo-daijin [Grand Minister] into Taishi.

Nakamaro, who backed up Emperor Junnin, started unique politics by promoting Tokuji policies (ruling a nation by virtue of a sovereign), which included raising the age of chunan (men between 17 to 20 years of age) and seitei (men between 21 and 60 years of age) and halving the amount of zoyo (irregular corvee), and also by adopting more Chinese-style systems such as renaming of the government posts in a Chinese style, (i.e. Daijokan [Grand Council of State] was changed into Kenseikan, and Daijo-daijin [Grand Minister] into Taishi.

Nakamaro, who backed up the Emperor Junnin, started unique politics by promoting Tokuji policies (ruling a nation by virtue of a sovereign), which included raising the age of chunan (men between 17 to 20 years of age) and seitei (men between 21 and 60 years of age) and halving the amount of zoyo (irregular corvee), and also by adopting more Chinese-style systems such as renaming of the government posts in a Chinese style, (i.e. Daijokan [Grand Council of State] was changed into Kenseikan, and Daijo-daijin [Grand Minister] into Taishi.
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 官職の唐風改称を参照）。
sen.e: For detailed information on the renaming of government posts, refer to the corresponding section.
For detailed information on the renaming of government posts, refer to the corresponding section.

sen.j: 仲麻呂は太保（右大臣）に任ぜられ、同年8月25日 (旧暦)（10月5日）、恵美押勝の名を与えられる。
sen.e: Nakamaro was appointed Taiho (Udaijin) and given the name of EMI no Oshikatsu in October 5, the same year.
Nakamaro was appointed Taiho (Udaijin) and given the name of EMI no Oshikatsu in October 5, the same year.
Nakamaro was appointed Taiho (Udaijin) and given the name of EMI no Oshikatsu in October 5, the same year.

sen.j: 同年、唐で安史の乱が起きたとの報が日本にもたらされ、仲麻呂は大宰府をはじめ諸国の防備を厳にすることを命じる。
sen.e: In the same year, upon receiving the information on the outbreak of Anshi Rebellion in Tang of China, Nakamaro ordered to reinforce the defense in various provinces including Dazai-fu (a local government office in Kyushu region).

In the same year, upon receiving information on the outbreak of Anshi Rebellion in Tang China, Nakamaro ordered to reinforce the defenses in various provinces including Dazai-fu (a local government office in Kyushu region).

In the same year, upon receiving information on the outbreak of Anshi Rebellion in Tang China, Nakamaro ordered to reinforce the defenses in various provinces including Dazai-fu (a local government office in Kyushu region).

sen.j: 天平宝字3年（759年）、新羅が日本の使節に無礼をはたらいたとして、仲麻呂は新羅征伐の準備をはじめさせた。
sen.e: In 759, in the wake of the report that Shiragi (an ancient Korean kingdom) took a rude attitude to a Japanese missionary, Nakamaro ordered to be prepared for the conquest of Shiragi.
In 759, in the wake of the report that Shiragi (an ancient Korean kingdom) took a rude attitude to a Japanese missionary, Nakamaro ordered to be prepared for the conquest of Shiragi.
In 759, in the wake of the report that Shiragi (an ancient Korean kingdom) took a rude attitude to a Japanese missionary, Nakamaro ordered to be prepared for the conquest of Shiragi.

sen.j: 軍船394隻、兵士4万700人を動員する本格的な遠征計画が立てられた。
sen.e: A full-scale expeditionary army was formed with 394 warships and 47,000 soldiers.
A full-scale expeditionary army was formed with 394 warships and 47,000 soldiers.
A full-scale expeditionary army was formed with 394 warships and 47,000 soldiers.

sen.j: この遠征は後の孝謙上皇と仲麻呂との不和により実行されずに終わる。
sen.e: This mission, however, was not put into place due to the feud between the retired Empress Koken and Nakamaro.
This mission, however, was not put into place due to the feud between the retired Empress Koken and Nakamaro.
This mission, however, was not put into place due to the feud between the retired Empress Koken and Nakamaro.

sen.j: 天平宝字4年（760年）、仲麻呂は皇族以外で初めて太師（太政大臣）に任ぜられる。
sen.e: In 760, Nakamaro was appointed the first Taishi (Daijo-daijin [Grand Minister]) except imperial family members.
In 760, Nakamaro was made the first Taishi (Daijo-daijin [Grand Minister]) not from the imperial family.
In 760, Nakamaro was made the first Taishi (Daijo-daijin [Grand Minister]) not from the imperial family.

sen.j: 同年、光明皇太后が逝去した。
sen.e: In the same year, Empress Dowager Komyo died.
In the same year, Empress Dowager Komyo died.
In the same year, the Empress Dowager Komyo died.
sen.cmt: Empressの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 皇太后の信任厚かった仲麻呂にとっては大きな打撃となる。
sen.e: It was a huge setback for Nakamaro who enjoyed the deep confidence of Empress Dowager Komyo.
It was a huge setback for Nakamaro who enjoyed the deep confidence of Empress Dowager Komyo.
It was a huge setback for Nakamaro who enjoyed the deep confidence of the Empress Dowager Komyo.
sen.cmt: Empressの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 天平宝字5年(761年)、淳仁天皇と孝謙上皇を近江国の保良宮に行幸させる。
sen.e: In 761, Emperor Junnin and the retired Empress Koken were sent to Hora no Miya Palace (a detached palace) of Omi Province.
In 761, Emperor Junnin and the retired Empress Koken were sent to Hora no Miya Palace (a detached palace) of Omi Province.
In 761, the Emperor Junnin and the retired Empress Koken were sent to Hora no Miya Palace (a detached palace) of Omi Province.
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 唐の制度にならって保良宮を「北宮」、難波宮を「西宮」とする。
sen.e: Hora no Miya' Palace and 'Naniwa no Miya' Palace were renamed 'Kita no Miya' Palace and 'Nishi no Miya' Palace respectively based on the Tang system of China.
Hora no Miya Palace and Naniwa no Miya Palace were renamed 'Kita no Miya' Palace and 'Nishi no Miya' Palace respectively based on the Tang system of China.
Hora no Miya Palace and Naniwa no Miya Palace were renamed 'Kita no Miya' Palace and 'Nishi no Miya' Palace respectively based on the Tang system of China.

sen.j: 天平宝字6年（762年）、仲麻呂は3人の息子の藤原真先、藤原訓儒麻呂、藤原朝狩を参議につけた。
sen.e: In 762, Nakamaro promoted his three sons, FUJIWARA no Masaki, FUJIWARA no Kusumaro and FUJIWARA no Asakari to Sangi (a councilor).
In 762, Nakamaro promoted his three sons, FUJIWARA no Masaki, FUJIWARA no Kusumaro and FUJIWARA no Asakari to Sangi (councilor).
In 762, Nakamaro promoted his three sons, FUJIWARA no Masaki, FUJIWARA no Kusumaro and FUJIWARA no Asakari to Sangi (councilor).

sen.j: この頃、病になった孝謙上皇を看病した道鏡が上皇に寵愛されはじめた。
sen.e: Around that time, Dokyo who took care of sick retired Empress Koken started to be favored by her.
Around that time Dokyo, who took care of sick retired Empress Koken, started to be favored by her.
Around that time Dokyo, who took care of sick retired Empress Koken, started to be favored by her.

sen.j: 仲麻呂は淳仁天皇を通じて、孝謙上皇に道鏡との関係を諌めさせた。
sen.e: Nakamaro told Emperor Junnin to persuade the retired Empress Koken to refrain from favoring Dokyo.
Nakamaro told Emperor Junnin to persuade the retired Empress Koken to refrain from favoring Dokyo.
Nakamaro told the Emperor Junnin to persuade the retired Empress Koken to refrain from favoring Dokyo.
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: これが孝謙上皇を激怒させ、上皇は出家して尼になるとともに天皇から大事・賞罰の大権を奪うことを宣言した。
sen.e: This enraged the retired Empress, who then proclaimed to enter a nunnery and to strip the Emperor Junnin of his sovereign authority to handle major political matters and to award honors and punishment.

This enraged the retired Empress, who then announced that she would enter a nunnery and strip the Emperor Junnin of his sovereign authority to handle major political matters and to award honors and punishment.

This enraged the retired Empress, who then announced that she would enter a nunnery and strip the Emperor Junnin of his sovereign authority to handle major political matters and to award honors and punishment.

sen.j: しかし、この実現については研究者のあいだでも理解が分かれる。
sen.e: However, researchers are divided whether or not her decisions were materialized.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, researchers are divided whether or not her decisions materialized.
However, researchers are divided whether or not her decisions materialized.

sen.j: 孝謙上皇の道鏡への寵愛は更に深まり、天平宝字7年（763年）、少僧都とした。
sen.e: The retired Empress Koken deepened her love to Dokyo even further and promoted him to Shosozu (a junior prelate).
The retired Empress Koken deepened her love to Dokyo even further and promoted him to Shosozu (a junior prelate).
The retired Empress Koken deepened her love to Dokyo even further and promoted him to Shosozu (a junior prelate).

sen.j: 藤原仲麻呂の乱
sen.e: Rebellion of Fujiwara no Nakamaro
Rebellion of Fujiwara no Nakamaro
Rebellion of Fujiwara no Nakamaro

sen.j: 孝謙上皇・道鏡と淳仁天皇・仲麻呂との対立は深まり、危機感を抱いた仲麻呂は天平宝字8年（764年）、都督に任じ、さらなる軍事力の掌握を企てた。
sen.e: Amid a deepened confrontation between 'the retired Empress Koken and Dokyo' and 'Emperor Junnin and Nakamaro', Nakamaro felt his position was threatened and had himself appointed as Totoku (a governor general) to obtain more military power.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Amid a deepened confrontation between 'the retired Empress Koken and Dokyo' and 'Emperor Junnin and Nakamaro', Nakamaro felt his position was threatened and had himself appointed as Totoku (a governor general) to obtain more military power.

Amid a deepened confrontation between 'the retired Empress Koken and Dokyo' and 'the Emperor Junnin and Nakamaro', Nakamaro felt his position was threatened and had himself appointed as Totoku (a governor general) to obtain more military power.
sen.cmt: Empressの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: しかし、謀反との密告もあり、淳仁天皇の保持する御璽・駅鈴を奪われるなど孝謙上皇に先手を打たれて、仲麻呂は平城京を脱出する。
sen.e: However, this attempt was disclosed as a rebellion against the retired Empress Koken, and Emperor Junnin was striped of the gyoji (an imperial seal) and the ekirei (a bell needed for the exercise of the imperial power) by the retired Empress, forcing Nakamaro to flee the Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, this attempt was disclosed as a rebellion against the retired Empress Koken, and Emperor Junnin was stripped of the gyoji (imperial seal) and the ekirei (a bell needed for the exercise of the imperial power) by the retired Empress, forcing Nakamaro to flee the Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara).

However, this attempt was disclosed as a rebellion against the retired Empress Koken, and the Emperor Junnin was stripped of the gyoji (imperial seal) and the ekirei (a bell needed for the exercise of the imperial power) by the retired Empress, forcing Nakamaro to flee the Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara).
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 子の藤原辛加知が国司の越前国に入り再起を図るが官軍に阻まれて失敗。
sen.e: He moved to Echizen Province, where his son, FUJIWARA no Shikachi, served as Kokushi (provincial governor), to regain power, but failed due to the interruption by the government army.
He moved to Echizen Province where his son, FUJIWARA no Shikachi, served as Kokushi (provincial governor), to regain power, but failed due to interference by the government army.
He moved to Echizen Province where his son, FUJIWARA no Shikachi, served as Kokushi (provincial governor), to regain power, but failed due to interference by the government army.

sen.j: 仲麻呂は近江国高島郡の三尾で最後の抵抗をするが官軍に攻められて敗北する。
sen.e: Although Nakamaro made a final stand in Sanbi, Takashima County, Omi Province, the government army defeated him in the end.
Although Nakamaro made a final stand in Sanbi, Takashima County, Omi Province, the government army defeated him in the end.
Although Nakamaro made a final stand in Sanbi, Takashima County, Omi Province, the government army defeated him in the end.

sen.j: 敗れた仲麻呂は妻子と琵琶湖に舟をだして逃れようとするが官兵石村石楯に捕らえられて斬首された。
sen.e: Nakamaro tried to run away with his wife and sons to Biwa-ko Lake by boat, but was caught by an army personnel, IWARE no Iwatate, to be beheaded.
Nakamaro tried to run away with his wife and sons to Biwa-ko Lake by boat, but was caught by an army personnel, IWARE no Iwatate, to be beheaded.
Nakamaro tried to run away with his wife and sons to Biwa-ko Lake by boat, but was caught by an army personnel, IWARE no Iwatate, to be beheaded.

sen.j: 仲麻呂の一族はことごとく殺されたが、六男・藤原刷雄は死刑を免れて隠岐国に流されて、桓武天皇の時代に大学頭・陰陽頭を歴任している。
sen.e: Every member of the Nakamaro family was killed except his sixth son, FUJIWARA no Yoshio, who was spared his life and sent to Oki Province and later appointed as Daigaku no kami (a director of the Bureau of Education) and as Onmyo no kami (a director of Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination) one after another in the era of Emperor Kanmu.

Every member of the Nakamaro family was killed except his sixth son, FUJIWARA no Yoshio, who was spared his life and sent to Oki Province and later appointed as Daigaku no kami (a director of the Bureau of Education) and as Onmyo no kami (a director of Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination) one after another in the era of Emperor Kanmu.

Every member of the Nakamaro family was killed except his sixth son, FUJIWARA no Yoshio, who was spared his life and sent to Oki Province and later appointed as Daigaku no kami (a director of the Bureau of Education) and as Onmyo no kami (a director of Onmyoryo, or Bureau of Divination) one after another in the era of the Emperor Kanmu.
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: また、十一男と伝わる徳一も処刑されず東大寺に預けられて出家し、筑波山知足院中禅寺の開山者となる。
sen.e: Also, his purported 11th son, Tokuitsu, was not killed either, but sent to Todai-ji Shrine to enter into priesthood, and later became the founder of Chisoku-in Temple on Mt. Tsukuba.
Also, his purported 11th son, Tokuitsu, was not killed either, but sent to Todai-ji Shrine to enter into priesthood, and later became the founder of Chisoku-in Temple on Mt. Tsukuba.
Also, his purported 11th son, Tokuitsu, was not killed either, but sent to Todai-ji Temple to enter into priesthood, and later became the founder of Chisoku-in Chuzen-ji Temple on Mt. Tsukuba.
sen.cmt: ShrineをTempleに変更しました。Chuzen-jiを挿入しました。

sen.j: また、仲麻呂の推進してきた政策のうち官名の唐風改称こそは廃されて元に戻されたものの、養老律令をはじめ多くの政策が一部修正を加えられながらも、その後の政権によって継続されている。
sen.e: Among the policies Nakamaro promoted, many of them including Yoro Ritsuryo Code, were passed on to the subsequent governments after some amendments were made, except the renaming of the governmental posts which were returned to the originals soon afterward.

Among the policies Nakamaro promoted, many of them including Yoro Ritsuryo Code, were passed on to the subsequent governments after some amendments were made, except the renaming of the governmental posts which were returned to the originals soon afterward.

Among the policies Nakamaro promoted, many of them including Yoro Ritsuryo Code, were passed on to the subsequent governments after some amendments were made, except the renaming of the governmental posts which were returned to the originals soon afterward.
